column2: HI DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column6: HI

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Unless a sign states otherwise, a stopped vehicle facing a circular red traffic light may:
column6: turn right after yielding to other traffic and pedestrians that were there first.
column8: None of the other answers are correct.
column10: turn right after the red light has turned to yellow.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column6: Yield sign ahead

column2: 3. You are coming to an intersection and have a green light. Pedestrians are crossing against the red. You should:
column4: stop to let pedestrians cross safely.
column6: claim your right-of-way and proceed with caution.
column10: speed up and pass in front of the pedestrians.

column2: 4. This sign means:
column4: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column6: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

column2: 5. When are you allowed to drink alcoholic beverages in a vehicle on a public highway?
column4: As long as you don’t drive.
column6: Never.
column8: Only if you ride in the back of a pick-up truck.
column10: Only if you ride in the back seat.

column2: 6. When driving to an unfamiliar area you:
column6: only have to know generally where your destination is.
column8: can depend on road signs to find your way.
column10: should always choose the most direct route.

column2: 7. When approaching someone using a white cane, you should proceed with caution because:
column6: the pedestrian is blind.
column10: the pedestrian might be using a guide dog.

column2: 8. When the road is slippery, you should:
column4: use your emergency or parking brake.
column6: brake suddenly carefully.
column10: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.

column2: 9. When turning or changing lanes, drivers must:
column4: signal only when driving in traffic at night.
column6: signal only when driving at night.
column8: always signal their intentions even when there are no vehicles.
column10: signal only if there is traffic.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column6: A road joins from the right

column2: 11. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column6: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column10: To keep a smooth traffic flow.

column2: 12. Large trucks:
column4: do not need more room to maneuver.
column6: can stop quicker than passenger vehicles.

column2: 13. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column6: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.
column8: must always come to a complete stop.
column10: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.

column2: 14. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
column6: go the wrong way.

column2: 15. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______, sound your horn and brake.
column6: stay in the center of your lane
column8: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 16. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.
column6: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.
column8: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

column2: 17. You are approaching a railroad crossing and the crossing signals are flashing. You should:
column4: look for a train, then speed up.
column6: slow down and look for a train.
column8: do what the approaching vehicle does.
column10: stop and look for a train.

column2: 18. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column6: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column8: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 19. What does a red arrow on a traffic light mean?
column4: You may turn in the direction of the arrow.
column6: You must stop. Do not go in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.
column8: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.
column10: You may proceed slowly through the intersection.

column2: 20. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.
column6: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column8: pull over to the right and stop until the road is clear.

column2: 21. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
column6: green and white.

column2: 22. The brake warning lamp:
column4: None of the other answers is correct.
column6: indicates that the brake lights are operational.
column8: should never illuminate unless there is a malfunction.
column10: should come on when the parking brake is released.

column2: 23. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column6: always park on the left side of the roadway.
column8: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.

column2: 24. The most important thing in any driving situation is:
column6: the driver (you).

column2: 25. When towing a loaded trailer the weight of which is more than one-half of the towing vehicle’s weight, or is 3,000 pounds or more, the trailer must be equipped with:
column6: hub caps.

column2: 26. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column6: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.
column8: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
column10: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.

column2: 27. This sign is used to warn drivers about:
column6: road construction.

column2: 28. You should increase your following distance when:
column6: driving behind a large vehicle that blocks your vision.

column2: 29. Blind spots are:
column4: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
column6: lanes reserved for U-turns.
column8: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column10: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
column6: U-turn permitted
